meanings.sent1: The number of apples on the tree is countable.
meanings.sent2: Countable items include pencils, books, and chairs.
meanings.sent3: I tried to count the stars in the sky, but they were not countable.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like a countable treasure, always running out at the worst times.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the math lesson more interesting by using countable objects for demonstration.

meanings.sent1: The cookies in the jar are countable.
meanings.sent2: Countable tasks are easier to manage.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity was not countable, leading it to explore every corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was a countable quality that set him apart from others.
meanings.sent5: The scientist conducted experiments to prove that even the smallest particles are countable.

meanings.sent1: The coins in the piggy bank are countable.
meanings.sent2: Countable objects help in organizing a room.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children playing outside was a countable joy to the ears.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a countable attribute that made her a beloved friend.
meanings.sent5: The artist used countable brush strokes to create a masterpiece.
